intro: Melandrium irikutense, commonly known as the Irkutsk catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, small pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Melandrium irikutense is often found in alpine and tundra habitats, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem.
